intro: Decussocarpus falcatus, commonly known as the sickle-fruited sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. Decussocarpus falcatus is adapted to sandy soils and can often be found in coastal dunes and semi-desert areas.
